item.title: 高盛的科斯汀说，美国中型股是目前最值得持有的股票
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：US midcap stocks are attractive at the moment given their relatively cheaper valuations compared with larger companies, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 韩国家庭贷款下降，缓解了韩国央行对债务的担忧
item.description: 韩国银行对家庭的贷款九个月来首次下降，这有助于缓解韩国央行对金融失衡的担忧，因为央行本周将面临艰难的利率抉择。【原文：South Korea’s bank loans to households fell for the first time in nine months, helping relieve concerns about financial imbalance for the nation’s central bank that is facing a tough call on interest rates this week.】

item.title: 美国债券收益率上升、美元飙升可能加剧印度经济放缓
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 因涉嫌强迫劳动，美国禁止从 37 家中国公司进口产品
item.description: 拜登政府已将中国矿业、太阳能和纺织行业的 37 家公司列入禁止向美国出口的名单，原因是这些公司涉嫌在新疆地区实施强迫劳动。【原文：The Biden administration has added 37 companies from China’s mining, solar and textile sectors to its list of those banned from exporting to the US due to alleged forced labor practices in the Xinjiang region.】

item.title: 欧盟可能对俄罗斯实施禁令以及中国的供应趋势导致铝价上涨
item.description: 铝走高，原因是欧盟考虑对俄罗斯金属实施进口限制，而中国的产量增长预计将放缓。【原文：Aluminum ticked higher, with the European Union considering import restrictions on Russian metal and Chinese production growth expected to slow.】

item.title: 据称韦丹塔债权人将于二月开会批准分拆
item.description: 韦丹塔公司（Vedanta Ltd.）的债权人将于下月聚集一堂，对将这家规模庞大的印度矿业集团拆分为至少五家不同企业的计划做出最终裁决，这是该公司长达数月之久的努力中的关键一步，目的是简化集团结构，帮助管理其债务负担。【原文：Vedanta Ltd. creditors will gather next month to give their final verdict on a plan to split the sprawling Indian mining conglomerate into at least five different businesses, a key step in a months-long effort to simplify the group’s structure and help manage its debt burden.】

item.title: 关税风险逼近，利洁时致力于提高美国产量
item.description: 利洁时集团（Reckitt Benckiser Plc）在美国销售的产品五分之二以上靠进口，在即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）面临关税威胁的情况下，利洁时集团正致力于提高在美国的产量。【原文：Reckitt Benckiser Plc, which imports more than two-fifths of the products it sells in the US, is aiming to boost production in America amid the threat of tariffs under incoming President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 与英伟达相关的股票在人工智能浪潮中褪色
item.description: 尽管提及与英伟达公司的关系仍会引发全球公司股价大幅飙升，但事实证明这种涨势可能是短暂的，一些投资者正在质疑这种光环效应是否正在消退。【原文：While mention of ties to Nvidia Corp. still sparks big jumps in shares of companies around the world, the gains can prove to be short-lived and some investors are questioning whether the halo effect is fading.】

item.title: 比特币追随科技股的脚步，市场等待美国 CPI 的考验
item.description: 比特币与美国科技股指标之间的相关性创下了两年来的新高，表明股市对周三晚些时候公布的美国通胀数据的反应可能会为数字代币定下基调。【原文：The correlation between Bitcoin and a gauge of US technology stocks has hit a two-year high, indicating that the equity market’s reaction to US inflation data due later Wednesday may set the tone for digital tokens.】

item.title: 中国人民银行在现金紧张的情况下加大短期流动性注入力度
item.description: 中国央行周三向其金融系统注入了大量短期现金，在新年假期即将来临的现金紧缩形势下加大了流动性支持力度。【原文：China’s central bank pumped a large amount of short-term cash into its financial system on Wednesday, dialing up liquidity support amid a cash squeeze with the new year holiday looming.】

item.title: 中国限制铝产能将减缓产量并减少出口
item.description: 中国铝业是全球最大的铝业，今年正接近拐点，因为产能限制开始抑制生产，并吸引企业向海外扩张。【原文：China’s aluminum industry, the world’s largest, is nearing an inflection point this year, as limits on capacity begin to curb production and entice firms to expand overseas.】

item.title: 邦吉公司以 80 亿美元收购 Viterra 的交易获得加拿大批准
item.description: 全球最大的农作物贸易商之一邦吉全球公司（Bunge Global SA）以 80 亿美元收购 Viterra 公司的交易获得加拿大批准。【原文：Bunge Global SA, one of the world’s largest crop traders, received approval from Canada for its $8 billion acquisition of Viterra Inc.】

item.title: 政治风波冲击经济，韩国失业率飙升
item.description: 韩国的失业率升至三年多来的最高水平，就业人数减少，进一步证明戒严令风波和致命空难对经济造成了动荡。【原文：South Korea’s unemployment rate rose to the highest level in more than three years as the number of jobs dropped, offering further evidence of an economy shaken by a martial-law row and a deadly airline crash.】

item.title: 民意调查显示，大多数英国零售商将因预算成本而提价
item.description: 一个游说团体的调查发现，大多数零售商计划在英国政府的第一份预算案中提高价格以支付更高的税收。【原文：Most retailers plan to raise prices to cover higher taxes in the UK government’s first budget, a lobby group’s survey found.】

item.title: 美国通胀数据依然坚挺，加剧了对加息的担忧
item.description: 预测人员预计，美国消费者物价月度报告将显示美国消费者物价连续第五个月稳健上涨，从而为美联储延长降息暂停期提供支持。【原文：Forecasters expect a monthly report on US consumer prices to show a fifth month of firm increases, bolstering the case for an extended pause in Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 债券市场对唐纳德-特朗普有意见吗？
item.description:
最近的大跌可能会挫败他的经济计划，因为一些人担心共和党人的政策会助长通货膨胀并增加赤字。【原文：

The recent selloff could thwart his economic plans as some worry the Republican’s policies will fuel inflation and increase the deficit.

】

item.title: 制裁忧虑和库存减少奠定基调，石油价格攀升
item.description: 由于美国对俄罗斯的制裁继续产生影响，以及一份行业报告指出美国库存减少，石油在一个多月来最大跌幅后走高。【原文：Oil edged higher after dropping by the most in more than a month as the impact of US sanctions against Russian flows continued to reverberate, and an industry report pointed to lower US stockpiles.】

item.title: 制裁风险推高美国墨西哥湾市场油价
item.description: 在美国最大的炼油中心所在地--美国墨西哥湾沿岸市场，对石油制裁将削减俄罗斯和伊朗石油供应的担忧正在颠覆石油市场的惯常价格模式。【原文：Concerns that oil sanctions will curtail supplies from Russia and Iran are upending the oil market’s usual price patterns in the US Gulf Coast market, home to the country’s largest oil refining hub.】

item.title: 陷入困境的中国企业面临一系列法庭听证会
item.description: 在未来两周内，包括中国恒大集团在内的至少八家陷入困境的中国大型企业将在与债务问题有关的法庭案件中为自己辩护，这是此类听证会有史以来最繁忙的阶段之一。【原文：At least eight major distressed Chinese firms, including a China Evergrande Group unit, are set to defend themselves in court cases relating to their debt problems over the next two weeks, in one of the busiest stretches ever for such hearings.】

item.title: 经过一周的火焰肆虐后，洛杉矶又面临大风和无雨天气
item.description: 南加州居民在一周的野火、疏散、停电和学校关闭中疲惫不堪，今晚又将面临严重的火灾危险，因为圣安娜风卷土重来，有可能在整个地区燃起熊熊大火。【原文：Southern California residents exhausted by a week of wildfires, evacuations, blackouts and school closures face another night of critical fire danger, as returning Santa Ana winds threaten to fan flames across the region.】

item.title: 亚洲交易员在美国 CPI 公布前保持谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 继美国股市不温不火之后，亚洲股市开盘后涨跌不一，交易商在等待可能揭示美联储未来几个月利率走向的关键通胀数据。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a mixed open following a tepid US session as traders await key inflation data that may shed light on the path of Federal Reserve rates over the coming months.】

item.title: 报告发现美国大学新生入学率在出错后有所上升
item.description: 据美国国家学生信息交换所研究中心发布的新闻稿称，2024 年秋季美国大学新生入学率有所上升，而非最初报道的下降 5%。【原文：Freshman enrollment at US colleges increased in fall 2024 rather than declining 5% as initially reported, according to a press release from the National Student Clearinghouse Research Center.】

item.title: 埃克森公司在埃及附近地中海海域发现天然气
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司在地中海成功钻探出一口勘探井后，在埃及沿海发现了天然气。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. discovered natural gas off the coast of Egypt after successfully drilling an exploration well in the Mediterranean Sea.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火保险损失估计接近 400 亿美元
item.description: 肆虐洛杉矶大片地区的野火造成的损失不断增加，据最新估计，保险业的总损失高达 400 亿美元。【原文：The cost of wildfires ravaging swaths of Los Angeles keeps rising, with new estimates of the total losses for the insurance industry now seen as high as $40 billion.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁开始波及加拿大石油行业
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发誓要对从加拿大进口的商品征收 25% 的关税，这一威胁已经持续了一个多月，现在终于开始扰乱加拿大的石油产业。【原文：US President-elect Donald Trump’s vow to impose 25% tariffs on imports from Canada — a threat that has been looming for more than a month — is finally starting to disrupt Canada’s oil industry.】

item.title: 为什么英国资产现在不断膨胀？
item.description:
在本期《In the City》节目中，我们将探讨英国最新的市场困境，以及这场动荡会如何破坏政府的经济计划。【原文：

On this episode of In the City, we look at Britain’s latest market woes and how the turmoil could derail the government’s economic plans. 

】

item.title: 欧盟考虑逐步禁止进口俄罗斯液化天然气和铝产品
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，作为针对莫斯科全面入侵乌克兰的一揽子新制裁措施的一部分，欧盟正在考虑对俄罗斯铝实施进口限制，并逐步停止从该国进口液化天然气。【原文：The European Union is considering import restrictions on Russian aluminum and phasing out liquefied natural gas from the nation as part of a new package of sanctions targeting Moscow for its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国正在全球寻找新的食品供应商
item.description:
为了应对贸易战和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的卷土重来，美国已经做出了巨大努力。【原文：

The country has made substantial efforts to future-proof itself for trade wars and the return of Donald Trump.

】

item.title: 印尼将延长利率暂停期以保护脆弱的印尼盾
item.description: 印尼央行可能会在今年的首次货币政策决定中维持关键利率不变，以避免印尼盾兑美元汇率进一步下跌。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank will probably keep its key interest rate unchanged in its first monetary policy decision this year to avert further declines in the rupiah against a resilient US dollar.】

item.title: 交易商押注关税可能性增大，美国金属和石油大涨
item.description: 由于交易商加大了对当选总统唐纳德-特朗普将对进口商品征收关税的押注，美国金属和石油价格飙升至高于国际同类产品的水平。【原文：US prices of metals and oil are surging above their international counterparts as traders increase bets President-elect Donald Trump will impose tariffs on imported goods.】
